title: Strategy of Elimination
text: To eliminate variables, add the second equation to the first equation to remove the $$y^2$$ term.

title: Resulting Expression
text: What is the resulting expression only in terms of $$x$$ when the first and second equations are added?

title: Solve for $$x$$
text: To solve for the value(s) of $$x$$, divide both sides by $$2$$ and take the square root. Remember to include the ~ for the square root result.

title: Solve for $$y$$
text: To solve for y-coordinates, plug in both x-values to either the first or second equation and isolate the value of $$y$$.

title: Number of Answers
text: Since both $$x$$ and $$y$$ are squared, there are $$4$$ possible answers (positive and negative) for both $$x$$ and $$y$$. Choose the answer that falls in the third coordinate when graphed.
